title: An architect who built his dream tiny home in Colorado shares 30 photos that go behind the scenes of designing a tiny house
text:
Creating a customized tiny house is a big task.

From picking a style to designing around intricacies unique to a tiny house and dealing with unexpected issues during the build, there's a lot of work involved.

Business Insider talked to Greg Parham, owner of Rocky Mountain Tiny Houses, which designs and builds tiny houses with an emphasis on customization. Parham, who has a degree in architecture, and his team work closely with their customers, collaborating on the design and building processes to give them exactly what they want in their tiny house.

Read more: Here's what living in a tiny house is really like, according to people who traded their homes for minimalism

Parham walked Business Insider step-by-step through the creation of a tiny house, from initial sketches to real-life infrastructure. For the purposes of this article, we're illustrating the tiny house design and build process with photos of Parham's own tiny house, which he often uses as a model for trade shows.

Here's how tiny houses come to life.
description: Creating a customized tiny house is a big task. From sketches to real-life infrastructure, here's how an architect builds and designs tiny houses.
